intro: Neobartlettia sordida, commonly known as the dirty barlettia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
